alert.note: Alert for Coryell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 12 at 5:22PM CDT until April 12 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL CORYELL AND NORTH CENTRAL BELL COUNTIES... At 522 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Fort Gates, or 8 miles southeast of Gatesville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... McGregor, Mother Neff State Park and Oglesby. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter now! Get to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building and avoid windows. Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
